gui.tools

Class Recorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.tools.Recorder

  • public class Recorder
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs physical recording of commands performed on the UI into a text file located on the local disk, or into a list of UiEventSequence objects.
    Author:
    Michaela Bacikova, Slovakia, michaela.bacikova@tuke.sk

    • Method Detail

      • createNewFile

        public void createNewFile()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new file with an automatically generated name. Also creates a new uiEventSequence.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an error during the file creation

      • createNewFile

        public void createNewFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new file with the user given name
        Parameters:
        fileName - the user given file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of an error during the file creation

      • createNewUiSequence

        public void createNewUiSequence()
        Creates a new UiEventSequence instance.

      • closeWriter

        public void closeWriter()
        Closes the BufferedWriter instance.

      • record

        public void record(java.lang.String command)
        Writes one command into a text file. If the recorder is not recording (the recording flag is set to false) or if the command is null or empty string, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        command - command, which should be recorded.

      • record

        public void record(UiEvent uiEvent)
        Records a uiEvent into a uiSequence
        Parameters:
        uiEvent -

      • isRecording

        public boolean isRecording()
        Returns the value of the recording flag representing the state of the recording process.
        Returns:
        true if the recording is running, false otherwise.

      • setRecording

        public void setRecording(boolean recording)
        Sets the value of the recording flag representing the state of the recording process.
        Parameters:
        recording - the value of the recording flag

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName()
        Returns:
        The name of the file to record to.

      • writeResultToConsole

        public void writeResultToConsole()
        Writes the recorded UI event sequence into the console.
